article.headline: Stony Brook 68, Boston U. 62, OT
article.story: STONY BROOK, N.Y. (AP) -- Mitchell Beauford had five of his 18 points in overtime and Stony Brook beat Boston University 68-62 on Thursday night, snapping the Seawolves' seven-game losing streak to the Terriers. Solomon Bamiro added 15 points for Stony Brook (7-11, 2-4 America East), which had lost two straight and five of six. The Seawolves' last win over Boston University was on Feb. 11, 2003. Freshman Corey Lowe had 20 points, eight rebounds and six assists for the Terriers (6-11, 3-2), who had won three straight after losing six in a row. Lowe made one free throw with 8.8 seconds left in regulation to give the Terriers a 49-47 lead. Ricky Lucas, the Seawolves' leading scorer with a 15.1 average, took a foul-line jumper with 2 seconds left and the ball bounced on both sides of the rim before falling through at the buzzer for his first points of the game. The Seawolves scored the first seven points of the overtime and led 59-51 with 1:21 to play. Tyler Morris, the Terriers' leading scorer at 14.1 points per game, hit two 3s -- his first points of the game -- in a 7-2 run that got Boston within 61-58 with 41 seconds left. Beauford was fouled going to the basket 4 seconds later, on what was called an intentional foul on Omari Peterkin. Beauford made both free throws and Emanuel Neto made two more after he was fouled on the inbounds pass and the Terriers were never closer than five points the rest of the way. Beauford finished 4-for-11 from the field but he was 10-of-12 from the free throw line. The loss dropped the Terriers to 0-4 in overtimes game this season.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
